attributes.action: Ban strip clubs in the UK. Strip clubs are demeaning and sexually exploitive.
attributes.background: Ban strip clubs in the UK. They are demeaning, degrading and sexually exploitive to women. Whilst these establishments exist they pose a major obstacle to achieving equality between the sexes. Strip clubs convey the idea that women can be bought and hold no value. It is well past time for change.
attributes.additional_details: Strip clubs have no place in a civilised society where equality should be the norm, not the exception. It is time for women to be treated with respect and valued for more than their bodies. Allowing such an industry to exist encourages sexual violence and exploitation to women. Let's adopt the icelandic approach and ban these outdated institutions. If society does not value women enough to ban this archaic display of sexism then how can we expect women to value themselves. It is time for change.

attributes.action: The UK legal definition of rape should change to the US version.
attributes.background: The UK law means only penetration with a penis is considered rape. Instead, the US version should be used. This covers all forms of forced penetration. Penetration from an object can cause the same trauma as when penetrated by a penis, yet these victims attackers can get off more lightly.
attributes.additional_details:
UK DEFINITION

https://www.legislation.gov.uk/ukpga/2003/42/part/1/crossheading/rape

Definition of rape - ( This version means only men can be charged and only when using their penis. )

"he intentionally penetrates the vagina, anus or mouth of another person (B) with his penis,
(b)B does not consent to the penetration, and
(c)A does not reasonably believe that B consents."


US DEFINITION 

https://www.justice.gov/archives/opa/blog/updated-definition-rape

Definition of rape - 

“The penetration, no matter how slight, of the vagina or anus with any body part or object, or oral penetration by a sex organ of another person, without the consent of the victim.”

attributes.action: Make it non-compulsory for students to pay for a tv license
attributes.background: If students can prove that a tv license has been paid for at their home address there should be no need to pay for a license at their student accommodation.
attributes.additional_details: Currently students do not have to pay council tax at student accommodation, this should also apply for tv license.

attributes.action: Create provision in law for Overtime Payments & max normal hours to be 40/week!
attributes.background: In current Law there is no provision for maximum working week i.e. what hours an employee must work on normal basis and there is no provision for overtime payments. Working over for free IS EXPLOITATION. and we, the working people who are your employers do deserve payment for worked hours!
attributes.additional_details:
Please set the following in the Employment Law: 
- max contractual normal working hours to be 40 hours per week 
 and anything above and over 40hours/week to be considered overtime 
- make an explicit provision in law that any overtime must be paid for 
 and minimum rates shall be: 
 - 1.33x or above for overtime worked on a normal working day 
 - 1.50x or above for overtime worked on Saturday 
 - 2.00x or above for overtime worked on Sunday or Public/Bank Holiday 
Working for Free is EXPLOITATION

attributes.action: Make payment from net income for residential care tax deductible for over 70's
attributes.background: The cost of residential and social care is extremely high. My Mother is 90 years old and has been in a residential home for three years. Her total income does not fully meet her monthly care charges. To alleviate the problem introduce a tax concession on bona fide care costs for those who pay.
attributes.additional_details: It would be a positive gesture from Government to recognise those who have made honest declarations and are subsequently burdened further by the tax system. The Government should also recognise that payments on account for current tax years are also onerous on meeting care costs and should be addressed. The Government should recognise that most people over the age of 70 are not on PAYE and the tax coding system is unreasonable for that population when in care.

attributes.action: Increase threshold for considering a petition for debate from 100,000 signatures
attributes.background: 100,000 signatures is not a true reflection of the population, and should not be debated in parliament. Present day we have 67 million people in the UK and so 1% of the population would be a more realistic figure. This then can be reviewed every 10 million the population increases.I

attributes.action: Abolish married couple's allowance and marriage allowance
attributes.background: This legislation is outdated and discriminatory. It discriminates against asexuals and aromatics. It is also sexist as for those on married couple's allowance (who married before December 2005), the break is based in the husband's income regardless of who actually earns the most.
attributes.additional_details: I believe this law to be in breach of the Equality Act 2010 as it discriminates on the basis of sexuality and (in the case of the married couple's allowance) gender. I believe this to be archaic and not at all fitting with the present times - married people are not any poorer than cohabiting or single people. So why should they be taxed less? Why do we still have a law that is based on the husband's income? It's 2018 isn't it?

attributes.action: Make all religious organisations give equal opportunities to men and women
attributes.background: Employment opportunities must be open to all without discrimination by law. The same must apply to all employment offered by religious organizations in Britain. The sex of the applicant must be made irrelevant.

attributes.action: Make using someone else’s pictures on dating sites a criminal offence
attributes.background: Using someone else’s photos and private details on social media, dating sites and sex sites should be illegal. It causes distress to the person being impersonated, can be used in a malicious way like I have had done to myself.
attributes.additional_details:
I have had my photo uploaded, nick name only family members know me by, location and made up sexual interests added to sex dating sites claiming I’m unhappily married. By someone I know. 

At the moment there is no law against this but this needs to change as it causes so much hurt and embarrassment, and is a nasty form of bullying. 

People are also lured in by the photo and think they are talking to this person when they actually aren’t which again just causes hurt and embarrassment.

attributes.action: Make it illegal for under 16's to have internet access on their mobile phones!
attributes.background: Children exposed to pornography at 9, cyber bullying see evidence link. Teenagers committing suicide because of cyber bullying, outrageous! They need constant supervision with the internet! It is far too dangerous and the safety of our children is the most important. It goes beyond parents control.
attributes.additional_details:
https://foreverymom.com/mom-gold/horror-stories-real-dont-give-children-smartphone-jonathon-van-maren/

I will give my daughter a cell phone when she is in year 6 and practising getting to school on her own ready for high school, but it will not have access to the internet, thats not going to stop other children who do have internet access from showing her inappropriate pictures or posting things about her though is it! For this to stop it needs to be illegal. They do not need internet access!

attributes.action: Widen the A21
attributes.background:
East Sussex only has 11 miles of dual carriageway in the whole county this puts off investors and home buyers to the county as all the roads are slow and congested 
The A21 was planned to be duelled but was scrapped in the 2010 spending review 
The A21 is voted Britain’s most dangerous road
attributes.additional_details:
Widening of the A21 is required from kiplings cross Tunbridge Wells to Hastings 
Lives can be saved and journey times imporoved massively! 
This will give Hastings and East Sussex the infristruture is so desperately needs! 
As a county we have no motorways and pretty much no duel carriageways this causes stress and frustration it’s 2018 it’s about time the government do something to help East Sussex being as the neighboring county of Kent has 3 motorways and plenty of duel caraigeways

attributes.action: Ask the government to increase funding for osteoporosis
attributes.background:
The information that is out there is vague nothing definitive also testing not done until too late in most cases 
Like lots of diseases early diagnosis is the way forward

attributes.action: Remove disability exemptions for the armed forces from the 2010 Equality Act
attributes.background: I was recently rejected by the Lancaster UOTC because of my Autism even though during their selection day in Liverpool I passed all their selection tests and completed all the required paperwork. They rejected me because I declared that I had a medical condition (Autism)
attributes.additional_details:
They rejected me because I declared on one of the medical forms that I have a medical condition (Autism). I had to declare it as it was a legal requirement. 
 
https://apply.army.mod.uk/how-to-join/can-i-join/medical
 
Autism is not included, yet on other British Army medical forms, one must disclose their Autism, and in turn they can be discriminated against because of this due to the exemption from parts of the Equality Act 2010.

attributes.action: Make cat calling an illegal act in the UK
attributes.background:
Cat calling refers to the act of shouting harassing and often sexually suggestive, threatening, or derisive comments at someone publicly. 

Surveys have found that 85% of people under 40 years old have taken a different route home to avoid harassment. Cat Calling should not have this power.
attributes.additional_details:
End Violence Against Women Coalition commissioned YouGov to conduct the first national poll on street harassment in 2016. The poll found that 64% of women of all ages have experienced unwanted sexual harassment in public places.

There are laws in the UK which focus on sexual misconduct but none specifically related to catcalling. This is not an impossible task with countries like Portugal, Belgium and France having already implemented such laws.

attributes.action: Include education on domestic abuse to the national curriculum.
attributes.background: I am a survivor of domestic abuse and violence which resulted in me losing my children. I think all children should be educated about domestic abuse so that they can identify it and so that they know it’s not acceptable.
attributes.additional_details: My experiences led me to write my experiences down and I’m waiting for a book to emerge be published. I’ve also set up a Facebook page called Parent Alienation Syndrome to help others in my situation.

attributes.action: make it a legal requirement to inform UK phone callers the cost of phone calls
attributes.background: The cost of phone calls from a mobile phone or landline should be regulated so that prior to connection a prerecorded message should make the charge per minute clear to the caller and all Utility companies and Charities for the low paid and vulnerable should have available freephone contact numbers
attributes.additional_details: Offcom really need to put their house in order they have consistently failed to inform the public about how much money they are paying for phone calls especially on 'pay as you go'. Some phone numbers in the UK which are regularly used by those on low incomes and those on benefits are being charged at exorbitant rates which they can ill afford. Im sue many of these people end up not making  calls because of the cost and end up being penalised for not informing a company or government department

attributes.action: Better treatment for NHS dialysis patients
attributes.background:
Government figures. I If a patient enters dialysis after the age of 
70to 75 life expectancy is 1 to 2 years. I entered at the age of 82 I am now in my 7th year.
attributes.additional_details:
Kidney failure
This petition could apply to any person of any age. 
I never had kidney failure, I had two operations 12 years apart each operation killed one kidney. 	 
I diagnosed myself and informed the doctor in writing more than a dozen times when I had a closure of an artery,  
There is a system for detecting closures it’s called a transonic flow meter it is used on patients once every three months? 
My petition is for the flow meter to be used on the patient four times a month with a minimum of twice a month.
It will mean patients living longer but that is what nursing is all about? 
Please sign this petition, you will be helping others and by unfortunate chance you might be helping your self.

attributes.action: Introduce free flu jabs for people using Lithium Carbonate for Bipolar disorder
attributes.background: Lithium Carbonate is considered to be the gold standard for controlling the symptoms of bipolar disorder, however, the symptoms of flu including diarrhoea, vomiting, dehydration and fever are exactly those which can cause Lithium toxicity which can quickly become fatal.
attributes.additional_details: By providing flu vaccinations, the government will be taking a pre-emptive step, reducing the risk of lithium toxicity while, at the same time, reducing the number of hospital beds taken up and allowing treatment of flu victims who require it.

attributes.action: Fund non-vocational degrees for people over 60
attributes.background: The Government should fund unallocated university places for non-vocational degrees for free, or for substantially reduced fees, to citizens over 60 who can demonstrate that they would be capable of completing their courses at a satisfactory level of attainment.
attributes.additional_details:
To expand on the idea of the U3A approach and to formalise it into a higher level of attainment for those wishing to pursue academic recognition.

To explore the Chinese model of learning available to older citizens in China: 
http://www.chinadaily.com.cn/a/201806/23/WS5b2d4787a3103349141de584.html

attributes.action: Set up a single tribunal service for all public services complaints/ grievances.
attributes.background: Call on the government to create a fair free tribunal body and procedure to hear complaints/grievances/appeals relating to failure, mistakes or misuse of power by those in all public services who conceal their wrongdoing.
attributes.additional_details:
The impact to people affected is simply being normalised and accepted as the way things are.

The public must have a right to a fair tribunal service & charter which allows their concerns to be heard when they have suffered failure/mistakes & gives the tribunal more powers to compel witnesses/public officers to testify. The public’s rights matter & they must be entitled to free access to justice & due process in disputes before an impartial judge as those in public office can use public money to conceal failure/mistakes & those affected have no voice & most cannot access legal assistance.

attributes.action: Make Michaelmas Day (29th September) a public holiday.
attributes.background:
Michaelmas (Mickle-mas) was The Feast of St Michael and was used to celebrate the final harvest.  Everything that couldn't be preserved was eaten in a great feast.

This holiday would be a dress rehearsal for Christmas, minus the relatives and presents!

attributes.action: Pass the Restroom Access Act 2005 (Ally's Law) in the UK
attributes.background: The Restroom Access Act 2005 is an act in the USA that requires establishments that have toilet facilities for their employees to also allow customers to use the facilities if the customer suffers from an inflammatory bowel disease or other medical conditon requiring immediate access to a toilet.
attributes.additional_details: There is not enough awareness of IBD in the UK, hopefully signing this petition will help bring out this awareness and pass the Act.

attributes.action: Safeguard School Milk Funding Post-Brexit
attributes.background: With funding for the EU School Milk Scheme under consideration, and the Nursery Milk Scheme being consulted on, millions of children may be at risk of missing out on milk that generations before them received. We're calling on the Government to commit to funding a replacement scheme post-Brexit

attributes.action: Ban body-shaming and bullying in magazines and newspapers
attributes.background: I have seen so many celebrity body-shaming and bullying in magazines and newspapers. Teenagers are reading it. It can affect their state of mental health especially, including using 'photoshop' photos, 'perfect' bodies. This is the only way it'll stop.
attributes.additional_details: Most recent is Stacey Solomon was on front of Now Magazine with headline 'boring' 'desperate' 'cheap' and why fans are sick of her because they saw a couple comments about her continuous positivity on body confidence, and next there was another story about revenge bodies, and it's wrong to do this, and there should be a ban on body-shaming, bullying in magazines, and should focusing on celebrating your body, and be confident in your skin, and what you look like.

attributes.action: Abandon government plans to include calories on all restaurant menus
attributes.background: The government’s plan to list calories on all restaurant menus not only will remove the joy of eating out at restaurants, but also is a cruel hinderance to those recovering from eating disorders. We need a more nuanced way to define what is “healthy” than obsessively listing and tracking calories.
attributes.additional_details: https://www.telegraph.co.uk/politics/2018/09/04/plans-force-restaurants-cafes-takeaways-display-calorie-counts/

attributes.action: Make Senior and 16-25 Railcards follow the same Time & Fare restrictions
attributes.background: The 16-25 Railcard is the same cost and appears to be the same as the Senior Railcard (for over 60's). However, the 16-25 card has a list of restrictions that do not apply to the senior card, including a minimum fare and time restrictions. Why are there not the same allowances?
attributes.additional_details: Apprentices, students & the young in work for the most, have to be up early for Uni/Work etc. and are notoriously hard up, at the start of there careers/working bottom end jobs. However while commuting to work as an apprentice, seeing a senior citizen go from there new range rover to the train, then be receiving a vastly discounted fare for the same journey does not seem fair. There are 2 sides as there are less well off elderly, and youth with money, however why give to one and not the other?

attributes.action: Make good facial growth a strategic health priority.
attributes.background: We ask parliament to make good facial growth a strategic health priority, through an early years education programme and through supporting Public Health England to make research, analysis and treatment policy in this area part of their next strategic plan.
attributes.additional_details: More information can be found on www.preventcrookedteeth.com.

attributes.action: Require phone providers to stop charging for handsets on expiration of contract
attributes.background: The government should make it law that mobile phone providers should be obliged to make sure that any customers staying in a contract past the end of a fixed deal have their monthly bill reduced to reflect the cost of the handset.
attributes.additional_details:
In October 2017 Citizens Advice found that three of the four largest mobile phone providers – Vodafone, EE and Three – continued to charge customers extra for a handset after it had been paid off as part of their fixed deal.  The majority of people who are caught out by this are the over 65s.

https://www.citizensadvice.org.uk/about-us/how-citizens-advice-works/media/press-releases/mobile-phone-networks-overcharging-loyal-customers-by-up-to-38-a-month/

attributes.action: Make Mental Health First Aid a compulsory element of teacher training.
attributes.background: I'm Ben, I've set up this petition as part of a teenage mental health awareness campaign started after my brother, Sam West, tragically committed suicide aged 15 in January 2018. Your signature won't bring my brother back, but it could save someone else's life and that's all I want.
attributes.additional_details: Some teachers, who will remain anonymous, have reacted positively to the idea when it was put past them stating that teachers often won't act at all as they don't have the knowledge or confidence to deal with the situation. A compulsory course will provide the confidence to at least approach a student about their mental wellbeing and start working on a solution. This vital next move, which is cheaper than alternatives, can combat the ever-escalating problem which is teenage mental health.

attributes.action: Stop plans for the Reception baseline assessment to be rolled out by 2020
attributes.background:
The government are introducing compulsory testing for children in reception with the aim of rolling it out by 2020. 
There are different ways of assessing children,these tests will be unreliable without taking into consideration the many factors that will be at play. They are simply just too young.
attributes.additional_details:
More info about the ins and outs of the assessment:

https://www.gov.uk/guidance/reception-baseline-assessment

News report:
https://www.theguardian.com/education/2018/apr/11/government-unveils-controversial-plan-testing-four-year-olds-england

There is a lot of research that suggests testing at this age can be detrimental to a child's development and learning:
https://www.tandfonline.com/doi/abs/10.1080/0141192032000060902

attributes.action: Ban any advertising for cars which aren't zero emissions.
attributes.background: We should treat cars and the pollution they create as a public health issue, as was done with smoking and the ban on cigarette advertising.

attributes.action: Stop the rebuilding of the Edmonton incinerator
attributes.background: Since the rebuilding of the Edmonton incinerator was approved in 2017 by BEIS, significant new evidence has emerged on the devastating impacts of poor air quality, especially on children and babies, as well as on the urgent need to reduce waste and tackle climate change.
attributes.additional_details:
The London Assembly: Burning waste takes materials out of the circular economy, releases carbon into the atmosphere and may have negative health effects… ..Investing in more EfW [incineration] can negatively affect long term recycling rates…incineration should not be exempt from London’s ambition to improve air quality. It is essential that London burns less organic and plastic waste, as well as recyclable materials.
https://www.london.gov.uk/sites/default/files/waste-energy_from_waste_feb15.pdf

attributes.action: Stop greyhound racing
attributes.background: We need all your signatures to stop this cruelty towards greyhounds. So many greyhounds are being injured and killed due to this, we need this to stop now.
attributes.additional_details:
https://www.theguardian.com/uk/2006/jul/17/animalwelfare.world

Please look at this link above for more information on this.

attributes.action: Make it legal for for all domestic knifes to have a rounded tip when sold in UK
attributes.background:
Reducing the risk of knife crime would be enhanced by rounding domestic knife tips.
There is no need for them and for commercial kitchens these should be sold under a record of sale. Taking weapons out of the home is an obvious easy solution which can be instigated by manufacturers under law.
attributes.additional_details:
Emergency surgeons are also asking for this as fatal injuries are caused by stabbing rather than slashing - reducing the number of knifes reduces the risk.

It simply needs the government to pass this.

attributes.action: Set maximum levels of council tax increases per year legislation across the UK
attributes.background: Local authorities are increasing their levels of council tax at unprecedented rates. These rates are dramatically higher than inflation levels and rather than look to make their local authority more efficient the only solution seems to be to increase the cost of living.

attributes.action: Fund 24 hour help for women who have miscarriages
attributes.background: Two of my sisters both had miscarriages and were left to go through this on their own at home bleeding and passing their babies alone. Handed a leaflet in the hospital with “ your miscarriage options” being told it’s nature. It might be nature but they are still heartbroken they are losing a life.
attributes.additional_details: People who are starting to bleed shouldn’t be told “oh the early pregnancy clinic closes at 5.30 you will have to wait until the following morning”. They shouldn’t have to stay up all night, not be able to sleep because of worrying, and not be able to get help when they most need it.

attributes.action: No longer require a foreign language as part of the English Baccalaureate.
attributes.background: Children studying at GCSE level are faced with the prospect of having to learn a foreign language. It's a worthless subject. If students wish to learn a language, they should not be forced to study one at school (Where they will likely be forced to study French/Spanish.) Let them learn themselves.
attributes.additional_details: Most students will not take the section of study seriously due to their disinterested nature. Perhaps, if they planned to visit a place, learning the language may seem more useful to them- Although typically this isn't the case. Take the Foreign Language GCSE from the English Baccalaureate and replace it with, perhaps another Science.

attributes.action: Legally required rescue insurance cover for adventure sports/outdoor pursuits
attributes.background: Rescue authorities are subjected to very expensive rescue operations which in many cases could have been avoided and are currently financed by the taxpayer. Rescuers are also risking their own safety. Thrill Seekers should meet the costs in the event of their rescue and have to take out insurance.

attributes.action: Ban synthetic pesticides and herbicides
attributes.background: Pesticides and herbicides are poisons that could destroy all living things & have catastrophic consequences for our health. We no longer recognize our country. A third of birds have died in the past 15 years, half of our butterflies. Pollinators are disappearing.
attributes.additional_details:
Read silent spring by Rachel Carson. 
They use glyphosate acid which is suspected to cause cancer, Parkinson's, infertility and birth defects. Several cases of the latter in France. 
Nous voulons des coquelicots in France are trying to get them banned. 
Monsanto, who make glyphosate pesticides, have been sued and lost by users getting cancer through use of their glyphosate pesticides. 
Let's ban them and save our countryside, animals and ourselves.

attributes.action: Limit parliament to 100 MP required to bindingly consult electorate on all votes
attributes.background: The UK parliament has ground to a complete standstill over Brexit and it is time to overhaul our system of representation.
attributes.additional_details: With the power of the internet public consultations with a clear binding direction to vote are within the power of the establishment to deliver. A system of routine meaningful public engagement would deliver a massive and uprecedented increase in democracy and accountability to the people of the UK and would remove any chance of any government being unable to deliver the will of the people. With the standard of the UK Civil Service having so many MPs is just not needed anymore and the cost is an unecessary burden to the UK.

attributes.action: Restrict National Lottery ticket Sales to Betting shops only
attributes.background:
Let us be clear. The National Lottery is GAMBLING no matter which way you dress it up. 
If one wishes to gamble on any other sport or Event they need to go to the betting shop. So why should the National Lottery be, any different?
attributes.additional_details:
Gambling can be just as strong and unhealthy addiction as Drugs, Alcohol & Tobacco and there have been plenty of measures taken against the promoting of Smoking and Drinking. 
The Government and Camelot both know however that if ticket sales were restricted to the bookmakers, then far less people would participate, as this would involve admitting to themselves that they are Gambling.This is why they're sold in shops in the first place. 
The question is; What's more important? People or Profit?

attributes.action: Require the Traffic Light System on all children’s food!
attributes.background: As an Early Years Practitioner, I have noticed how little the “Traffic Light System” is put on the children’s foods. I feel like this is a necessary so that the children can understand whether it is healthy or not. Colours are so simple to a child so this is a much better method than just numbers.
attributes.additional_details: The country encourages Healthy Eating however, they don’t teach children in the way that they would understand the best. Numbers mean nothing to the children, however, they realise that colours have meaning. For example; Red means Bad and Green means Good.

attributes.action: Ensure All UK Local Councils Provide Recycling Bins in All Public Spaces
attributes.background:
The recent advertising campaign, encouraging recycling at home is right, 'One Bin IS Rubbish!'

But what if you're on your way to work, eating lunch on the go, or on a night out? How do you recycle then?
Most local councils do not provide public recycling bins, sign here if you think they should.
attributes.additional_details:
The London Mayor is aiming to make London a Zero Waste City by 2026, but what about the rest of the UK?

Recycling schemes are organised and funded by local councils. However, this issue is not a local one, but a global one.

The government should make it mandatory to provide recycling bins in all public areas nationwide, and provide local councils funding to implement these bins and dispose of recycling correctly.

People may not throw away less rubbish, but we can throw it away, the right way.

attributes.action: Cancel South Western Rail’s contract
attributes.background: Since SWR took over, trains are routinely late, strike action has spiked and, despite a 3% fare increase, passengers have seen no respite. For the sake of the economy and the wellbeing of commuters, SWR should be stripped of their contract. They are not fit to run a rail franchise.
attributes.additional_details:
http://www.cityam.com/269303/waterloo-chaos-south-western-railways-tells-commuters-not

https://www.getsurrey.co.uk/news/surrey-news/how-south-western-railway-performed-14988660

attributes.action: Legislate a Less Lethal Firearms license for civilians
attributes.background:
A Less Lethal Firearms license should be legislated for civilians to purchase, possess, open carry and use PAVA Spray and/or a Taser.

This should be accompanied by a Firearms Act 2020 amendment with Section 5 exemptions for civilians with a license.
attributes.additional_details:
In the wake of increasing violent crime and strain on the Police Service, civilians with jobs such as Security Guards, Doormen, Delivery Guards and Neighbourhood Patrol groups should have a lawful right to a low risk form of OCW (Open Carry Weapon) for use in defence, escape and citizens arrests with lower casualty risks when confronted with physical violence.

Security checks and training in correct and lawful use should be mandatory before purchase and ownership of a Taser or PAVA Spray.

attributes.action: Expand The Dogs (Fouling of Land) Act 1996 To Cover All Animals.
attributes.background: In 1996 The Dogs (Fouling of Land) Act was introduced into the UK as an Act of the Parliament. The Act was created to make it a criminal offence if a dog fouls at any time on designated land and a person who is in charge of the dog at that time fails to remove the faeces from the land forthwith.
attributes.additional_details:
This petition proposes that the Act be expanded from dogs to include all animals where a person who is in charge fails to remove the faeces from the land forthwith.

References:
The Dogs (Fouling of Land) Act 1996 
Clean Neighbourhoods and Environment Act 2005

attributes.action: More funding for mental health awareness
attributes.background: There is not enough funding for mental health awareness. People know too little about it. It should be spoken about more freely, so we don't have to feel isolated and different from everyone else. We are not weird or strange, we are the same just with a different thinking process.

attributes.action: Make it a legal requirement for all public places to have baby change facilities
attributes.background: Currently there is no law in the UK requiring public places (restaurants, hotels etc) to provide baby change facilities. When visiting restaurants, parents are often asked to change their babies’ nappies on the vacant tables or seats. This is a health hazard and an embarrassment for the parents.
attributes.additional_details: From budget to five star hotels to high street restaurants are asking their customers to change their babies on vacant tables because no other available/suitable space on their premises. It should be a legal requirement to provide a safe, clean space inside customer toilets to change babies. This is something business can achieve for a minimal cost.

attributes.action: Mandatory regular lessons at school about first aid
attributes.background: Regular basic implementing first aid lesson at school, starting in primary school and in high school. Lessons have to be attended by all students, free of charge and at every school.
attributes.additional_details:
Even small children at primary can learn how to for example call an ambulance, describe symptoms, treat minor injures (put on a bandage). There was a story about a boy who call ambulance to her mother and save her life. 
I believe more lives can be saved if children learn what to do in emergency situations.

attributes.action: The school testing system need to change. Student choice of exam method.
attributes.background: I believe that the school testing systems need a serious change. The main way of testing are by exam papers, but this method of testing isn’t adaptable to everyone’s specific strengths, since you could be a mathematical genius but fail your exam papers.
attributes.additional_details:
To fix this I believe we should include oral testing with an examiner, or if you prefer coursework, then you can do coursework while maintaining the capability of what you can get in A level. This would give students the opportunity to choose the testing method that best suits their capabilities. 
We need to stop limiting the creativity of our generation. We weren't made to be programmed like machines with knowledge, then check if our knowledge was retained, then continue that cycle.
